This game was open for debate whether it would be called Dead by Daylight or Lobby Simulator 2016. Even during beta it was 75% of the game, and after initial release remained so. The Devs definitely told us it was being worked on so that a thing?

Once you do find a game it has many interesting strategies. Let me show you the progression and types of strategies held within this game.

Survivor
----------
Beginning Player:
Constantly causes the generator to blow up by missing Skill Checks. Then likes to run everywhere as it is definitely the quickest means to go from generator to generator. Also seeing teammates get hooked means killer is over there and well, no thanks. Also when you are hooked there tends to be more rage for teammates not helping you.

Intermediate Player:
You learn running leaves scratch marks so you walk around the outside the map to avoid detection. You learn there are jukes spots and infinites and utilities them all to make sure you don't get hooked. At this points you have semi-decent perks so use them for a little extra point generation and focus on doing generators and getting out. Anyone getting hooked is their fault, and unless the killer goes across the map really determines if you will help. If you do help anyone then any exit windows/pallets are your property. Self preservation is the main focus as you want to reach Rank 1.

Experienced Player:
You know a majority of the maps and know where to run the killer to avoid being hit for an extended period of time. You learn to utilize your items and addons to benefit yourself and the team, and you work majority of the generators while remaining unseen by the killers. Saving people depends on how close you are, but within sprinting distance usually will help everything short of facecamping. You also accept taking a hit from the killer really isn't the end of the world.

Veteran Player (200-300+ hours):
Rank 1 means nothing. You know all the maps very well, and tend to farm killers for boldness points. Using a flashlight pretty much guarantees you full boldness, and you don't use every single pallet knowing you may need it later. Saving people becomes much more fluid and means more points so you tend to contribute to most of the saves. You also tend to lose killers very well by hiding or using juke points along with a sprint burst to escape without to much hassle most of the time. You also learn that tanking hits is a very good strategy to ensure survival of your teammates. Being one hit just means less taunting or downtime between kiting the killer. Also every item can be used effectively (medkit - healing yourself quickly to jump back into action, toolkit to help get the others out quicker, map to not worry so much about gennys but to keep the killer busy).

Killer
----------
Baseline is so variant as a killer let me just express the details of what it means to be a killer in this game.

The survivors will infinite you. 
-Atleast 1 will do it all game.

Survive with Friends will be a pain in the ass because they will constantly be telling each other where you are and going for saves as soon as you turn your back.
-You will eventually learn to use this against them and get all the friends waiting for a save, as they are always obligated to help.

There will be trashtalk from any survivor who doesn't atleast black PIP, and if you kill all of them before black PIP will be called a cheater/hacker or an OP killer.
-Every perk you use will be stated OP on your class, and NOED with any class will be called a skilless perk.

Once you becomes very good at getting 3/4 or 4/4 survivors each game you learn that most survivors go to the same spots constantly, and that it isn't admitting defeat when you stop chasing one survivor after constantly being kited when multiple generators are already done. 
-Winning doesn't have to be quick, but just play smart and know how to keep them busy. Always apply pressure.

The game is very heavy survivor focused, and killers are becoming sparse, but to be honest it is the easiest way to Rank 1 and easiest point generation.
-Devs will eventually learn to stop nerfing everything and realize this is a 1v4.. this isn't supposed to be a in and out game every match.


OVERALL:

You learn this game is a grind, but very fun. You only play about 60% of the time as the other 40% is waiting for a game or being dodged. It's better to say GG then trashtalk as both sides can be very whiny and no need to fuel the fire.. especially when you have another 5 minute wait for a lobby ahead of you.

Rank means nothing, and prestiging just means you play a lot.
Devs will constantly be promising improvements, but sidetracking with content, which is good content but obvious diversion.

I love this game and will continue to play it but even so I would only give it a 4/5 as there could be a real chance at an everlasting game if they committed more work and charged more for the game to help fund resources for improvement.

2021 UPDATE: This game is a joke. The DEVS don't care about the player experience, and instead only do one small fix each month... which is just enough to last until their next killer and/or cosmetic release. They have no sense of how to fix bugs or what a good turnaround time is even when things seriously break. They take no accountability and instead of apologizing, make jokes and say the players complain too much. We complained because we loved the game, we leave though because you do the bare minimum to collect your paycheck and then go home. Honest opinion of someone who has played since beta... don't waste your money. BHVR doesn't care, so neither should you.

First off, I love this game. I have reached rank 1 survivor & killer. I have been around for all the patches, the complaints, the ups, the downs, the bugs, the dev stream, etc.

I do NOT recommend this game because...

1. The developers are VERY out of touch with their game. They have "statistics" they listen to, which are complete bullshit. 

For example, they decided to realease the new "The Last Breathe" DLC on a FREE WEEKEND and used THOSE statistics to see if the new killer/survivor was viable or not.  Which is just stupid, because loads of new players flooded the statistics with misinformation.

Also, MANY streamers, players, etc. all agree that nerfing the killers in the new beta would be a BAD idea. So what did they do? They did it anyways. DEVS WHY MAKE A BETA IF YOU WILL NOT LISTEN TO FEEDBACK?

2. The community is COMPLETE shit. Whether people complain about "KILLERS ARE OP AND CAMP" or "SURVIVORS ARE SO OP WITH INFINITES" nobody ever gets anywhere constructively, and the Devs are too out of touch to fix their shit. They added a post game chat, and 9/10 matches are toxic as hell.

3. Actual gameplay can be SO bad. The killer/survivors dictate whether one another are having fun or not. Thanks to the shit community, many players will exploit the SHIT out of anything they can.

Basically, I love all the positives about this game - it can be VERY fun, entertaining, and challenging. 

BUT, I will NOT recommend it to new people who want to buy it. If I were to start playing this all over again, I wouldn't.

In my opinion, DBD is a very good game, despite some bugs and problems. The dev team is working activly on the game and it gets more refined with every update. DBD seems balanced even tho there are certain map/killer combos who are better than others. The perks and add-ons are all well made and works well. Its a game I genuinly enjoy, but it might not appeal to everyone :)

Dead by Daylight is a team horror/survival game with unique gameplay, great atmosphere, and challenging game mechanics that don't fail to impress.

The Good
- Very Unique gameplay that takes a lot of skill and patience to learn, let alone master
- Lots of fun playing both the survivor and the killer once you've figured out some strats
- Perks and items add a lot of new challenges and variations in gameplay strats for both killer and survivor
- Atmosphere is great, sound and visuals do a good job at keeping you on edge, especially as the survivor
- Very unique feel to the team based gameplay, group doesn't live or die as a team, individual actions are important
- Devs seem to be still be working on the game and improving it
- Music is really good, and does a lot to enhance the feel of the game
- Very entertaining to watch
- Every action you take is important, and every decision you make matters.  It's very easy to die in this game so planning and strategy are hallmarks
- Game is unforgiving and not noob friendly, there is a high barrier to entry that must be overcome to "git gud"

The Bad
- Game is unforgiving and not noob friendly, there is a high barrier to entry that must be overcome to "git gud"
- Individualistic teamplay means that teamates will often abandon you if things go south
- Killers camping hooks, while a valid strategy, ruins the fun a bit
- Queuetimes can be really bad if not enough killers or survivors are playing
- Bloodweb leveling feels a bit pointless, a better leveling and perk system might help this game out
- Lots of grind to obtain perks, meaning it will be a while before you get to experiment with different builds
- Some perks are just terrible compared to others, the perks aren't well balanced

The Ugly
- The queue process is terrible.  If you don't get into the game, the system will kick you out and make you queue up again.  Queue should not have to be entered multiple times, the player should remain in the queue until he or she finds a game.
- Easy ways to exploit the blood system in multiplayer
- No blood given for playing with friends as the killer.  (And while I realize that allowing this would allow some serious exploits, they could have given a seperate bloodpool for offline play so you and your friends can still play together and level up in a different manner.)

Overall, I think this is a great game, but certainly not for everyone.  I'd recommend watching some videos before you get it, just to make sure it boasts the type of gameplay you're looking for.  Below is a video as a survivor, and you can find plently more videos on my YouTube page if you'd like to learn more.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MnKMItjnLss&list=PLjiM4pngkuyX4BPWdXnqc5YzOpyEYXe2a&index=5

このゲーム自体鯖というものはありませんが、steamの設定からダウンロード→ダウンロード地域をjapanからUSのロサンゼルスにするか、カナダにするとプレイ人口もアジアと比べ多いため比較的すぐにマッチングします。チートやラグもほぼ見かけません。

tl;dr: DBD is a great game! Lots of fun playing killer AND survivor, although it has its bugs (which hopefully will be patched sooner than later) - 100% buy worthy

My experience with DBD is (for the most part) great! It has its up- and its downsides. Sometimes you'll get angry at the game for dumb bugs, but I'd say no game is perfect and the devs are working on it constantly (heads up to the dev team!).


The gameplay from killer perspective is great. You are the one who is feared by the survivors and they try their best to hide from you while repairing generators to get away from you! For the most part, the map design is great, sometimes though it's a little survivor heavy with more juke points ("jungle gyms", "infiners"..) bunched together in too small areas.
Nevertheless I've been able to get almost any survivor who tries to abuse those spots (as long as its not a 100% infiner).


Looking at the game from a survivors perspective, you'll get a lot of fun out of it, if you aren't scared that quickly! Although.. after playing like 30 to 50ish hours, you'll not be scared by the look of the killer anymore which makes it a little easier to run, juke and get away from killers. The most notable difference between killer and survivor is the skill check mechanic on the survivors side which cause a visual and hearable feedback for the killer if they're failed.


Positive: 
+ lots of variety in builds / perks / items with addon combos
+ getting to play both perspectives is lots of fun
+ ability to play with / against friends
+ good game to play a few hours every now and then
+ free new content

Negatives:
- not the best matchmaking (yet, getting fixed soon)
- no real punishment for dc'ing (only killer benefits from dc'ing survivors)

All in all: 100% buy worthy, would reccomend

Well, now that the queueing system works propperly for the most part, this game is actually very enjoyable to play. I have been playing since beta, and I still have yet to lose any interest in the game. It's INCREDIBLY fun to play with friends against random killers.
This game definitely gets a 9/10. I highly recommend getting.

[ORIGINAL REVIEW]
I will be honest, I love this game. I have put in 31.6 hours as of this review, but I will tell you right now that about 75% of those hours were spent in their lovely queue system.

I spent $20 or so on this, and it the best $20 I have ever spent on a queue simulator. For a queue simulator, I am surprised it has such a good mini-game in it, where you play as 4 survivors against a killer.

All in all, I highly recommend this game if you enjoy sitting in the menu for half an hour at a time between the mini-games.

11/10 Would recommend to all my friends.

I haven't played much of this yet, at this point, only 2.1 hours. With that being said, I can tell that this game and I will be great friends. I no longer have real friends as I murdered them all, over and over again. 

I really only play killer at this moment, but I have played as a survivor as well. They're two completely different ends of the playability spectrum as they vary in difficulty. I will definitely play more of each "class" when I can. Until then, I feel like it's a good buy. 

The only thing I have an issue with right now, is the server load time when you try to join a game as a survivor. You don't really get that issue though as a killer because you actually create the lobby and people join in on you. When you're a survior though, it can be a bit tedious to find a game, and all I can suggest is that if you're adamant on playing as a survivor, just keep trying. Eventually you're going to find a game, and hopefully the killer is a good guy in regards to not camping.

First of all the core game is really fun but there are some HUGE balancing problems if you want to buy this game now and play killer!

First of all it takes like forever until you get the second perk slot (I have played for 30 hours in 1 week and have no second slot yet, neither killer nor survivor).
Second you get mixed with high level survivors pretty quickly and they all got 4 perks each at least lvl2.
Third the teachable perks of the survivors COMPLETLY DESTROY BALANCING! Every single survivor has saboteur, sprint boost and self care. These should be ITEMS (selfcare replaces first aid kits and sabotage the toolbox). Its hard enough to find and injure survivors but if you dont focus on one survivor at a time - and i mean untill he is dead - you have no chance! I have Iron grasp only on 2 killers yet and its lvl 1. If i go against 2 or 3 guys with sabotage i simply CAN NOT win. Because there are no hooks left on the map except the ones in the basement, but the way is too far most of the time.

Survivors are so much more powerful and easier to play than the killers and the killers will get nerfed in the next patch!!! Why? Because they are strong when they use Add ons? Survivors can use those too! And they can even find additional stuff in chests - killers only got what they "payed" for with collected Add-ons. I never use anything - neither item nor Add-on as a survivor because i don´t need to! If you have a good team the killer stands no chance!

So here my plead - REMOVE ALL TEACHABLE PERKS! - so every Survivor has his unique role to play! Each killer does and their perks are far inferior to the ones the survivors share!

Right now the game is just frustrating as a killer and no challenge at all as a survivor.

Btw. this is my first review i have ever written. I love this game, i really do but right now its on a bad path. I fear its going to disapear as quickly as it rose.
So please Behaviour - please give the survivors their unique roles back and even the odds between both sides again! The game should be decided by skill and strength of nerve and not just "who has farmed all perks yet".

Edit: The Developers worked hard on the balancing and have brought some new features in the game wich changed the meta. Now it´s fun to play and I can finally recomend it. But newcomers be warned: the game still needs some experience to be fun.

El título ha envejecido fatal, no consigue mantenerme entretenido ni dos partidas seguidas, se ha vuelto un sota,caballo,rey en toda regla, ha perdido completamente la esencia que tenía, para una persona que ya lo ha jugado unas cuantas horas se hace tedioso y repetitivo.

Típico caso con el nuevo sistema de endgame con cuenta atrás:

- Matan a tus compañeros y te quedas solo, intentas buscar la trampilla sin que te vea el asesino, pero el es más rápido, la encuentra antes y la cierra de una patada con lo que empieza la cuenta atrás, vas hacia una puerta despacio para que no vea tus marcas y esperas a que venga a campear la puerta en la que estás, se va a la otra pero... ¡Sorpresa! están prácticamente juntas y no tienes tiempo para intentar abrir ninguna de las dos, si esperas y vas abriendo cada poco se te acaba el tiempo y mueres, si vas a abrirla apurando un poco más te ve el asesino y te mata.

No tiene putô sentido.

Me parece un muy buen juego,con una tematica  bastante diferente y original.
Es muy entretenido y requiere de cierta estrategia.
A pesar de los comentarios negativos sobre la busqueda de partidas,no es del todo cierto.
Lo que pasa es que la mayoria de jugadores se meten como supervivientes y casi nunca de asesino.
El que entra como asesino es el que crea la sala de juego y los supervivientes se unen.
Yo estoy jugando mas como asesino y de esa manera no tengo que esperar casi nada para entrar en partida,ya que siempre hay supervivientes a los que colgar en ganchos jejej.
En mi opinion es mas divertido a la vez que dificil ser asesino.Y no estan OP como dicen algunos,ya que de superviviente es muy facil esconderse y ademas se juega en 3ª persona y puedes ver mejor lo que esta a tu alrededor.
Con el rol de asesino se juega en primera persona,y cuando te acercas a los supervivientes,a estos les palpita el corazon y saben que no andas lejos.Cuanto mas cerca mas rapido les va el corazon,a modo de aviso de que estas cerca de ellos.
En definitiva recomiendo el juego a todo el mundo que quiera probar algo diferente y pasar un buen rato.

Nach vielen Spielstunden bin ich glaube soweit ein Review zu veröffentlichen.
Wo fängt man da nur an.

Das positive ist definitiv ein spannendes Gameplay! Wenn man vom Killer gejagt wird können desöfteren schon mal sehr atemraubende Momente entstehen. Wer also gerne mal kurze knackige Spiele mag dem ist dies nur zu empfehlen. Auf jeden Fall ist es hilfreich das movement zu lernen...bei der Flucht als auch beim aufsuchen der generatoren, die man benötigt um die Ausgangstore zu öffnen und somit dem Killer zu entkommen. Ich pers. schaue gerne YouTube oder Twitch um mir ein paar Sachen abzuschauen ;-)
Auch sehr hilfreich ist es beide Varianten zu spielen - als Killer sowie als Überlebender. Denn die Spielweise wie man die maps am besten spielt sind sehr unterschiedlich. So lernt man als Killer gern genutze Spots kennen die von Überlebenden genutzt werden - und es als Killer einem schwer macht sein Opfer zu erreichen. Genau auch andersrum, auf der Seite der Überlebenden. Ganz nach dem Motto -Kenne deinen Feind-
Wer also über zahlreiche kleine Bugs hinwegsehen kann (Stand jetzt) kann zuschlagen. Die Devs bemühen sich hier wirklich um DbD zu einem tollen Spiel weiter zu entwickeln.

Kleiner Tipp vielleicht noch. Wer als Survivor starten möchte dem sei Claudette ans Herz gelegt. Sie hat starke Perks die einem das (über)Leben etwas leichter machen.

Negativ:
Bugs Bugs Bugs :-)
Es finden sich zahlreiche kleine Bugs im Spiel wieder. Beispielsweise steckt man fest als Killer und kann nur zuschauen wie die kleinen Survivor schamlos alle reperarieren etc. (passiert aber relativ selten)
Das Matchmaking ist nicht wirklich ausgreift. Es treffen manchmal Spieler aufeinander die vom Rang/Level her total unterschiedlich sind.
Wartezeiten in den Lobbys sind auch manchmal katastrophal wenn man nicht grad auf andere Länder ausweicht (Downloadregion bei Steam). Russland ist derzeit stark besiedelt - so das man dort sehr gute Chancen auf kurze Wartezeiten hat.

Ansonsten einfach noch ein paar andere Stimmen zum Spiel lesen...es ist nicht perfekt - aber Preis/Leistung passt allemal.

Me gusta mucho, se volvió un juego muy adictivo.
Tiene algunos bugs y el ranking no se ajusta muy bien entre asesino y sobrevivientes, pero las partidas son siempre diferentes unas a otras dependiendo de la habilidad de cada jugador.
¡Lo recomiendo y estoy a la espera de nuevas actualizaciones y mejoras!

[h1]flawed[/h1]
The match making of this game is horrible. If you even manage to get a game, then you better pray that the match is evenly matched. As a new player getting teamed up against prestiged rank 1 players who know every single trick, know every flaw in the map(for example a hill with hay up against a farming device which the killer cannot reach) and have every add-on. It is just really unfair towards new players . This counts for both being the killer and the survivor.

Which brings me to the next complaint. The grindy leveling aspect does not fit the purpose of a survival horror game at all. I would only recommend this game, when you are playing with friends in a non "ranked match" and make a gentlemen's agreement that everyone will use a vanilla loadout.

If you are planning to survive with your friends, great idea! But please wait until the next update, because it can take up to [b]30 mins[/b] ! if you are trying to find a lobby with a party.

Ůžasná hra, ještě jsem nehrál hru tohoto typu, doporučuji koupit a hrát ať je nás více :)

+Spolupráce tu je na prvním místě

-Zabiják Sestřička mi příjde moc OP, když máte získat čas díky barikádám apod. a ona se prostě před Vás teleportuje, tuhle postavu bych ze hry vymazal.
-Optimalizace
-Připojení za lidi je někdy oříšek, totální katastrofa, buď sáhodlouze čekáte a když už to vypadá nadějně tak Vás to hodí zpět do Lobby, nebo Vám tu hru prostě nechce žádnou vyhledat a píše to chybu, ovšem za zabijáka žádný problém není.
-Některé perky jsou až moc přehnané a znehodnocují výhody zabijáka, tudíž si někdy za zabijáka ani neškrtnete.
